content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Since the author already changed the what UnicornP has suggeseted, I think is the time to approve this. 
Great question for reverse mode

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Really nice one in revert or shortest mode!

There are quite a few improvements that need to be made before I would approve this, but the idea is good. Here are my suggestions:

» Statement: The letters of the alphabet occupy positions A=1, B=2, C=3... when listed in alphabetical order. Compute the sum of the alphabetical positions of the letters in the given sentence. The positions are case-insensitive, and non-letters are ignored.

» Input: A sentence

» Output: An integer representing the sum of the alphabetical positions of the letters in the sentence

» Constraints:
1 ≤ len(sentence) ≤ 256
Characters are either uppercase or lowercase letters, spaces, or {{! @}}

Note that your current solution only excludes ASCII characters below 64, which means that characters like { or ^ would not be handled correctly. You need to address this explicitly in your statement and constraints (I took a guess and assumed that only !, @, and spaces were your intention).

You're absolutely right, I'm making the changes.
Thank you !
